I encountered this over and over again on our servers, with pytorch most of the time but also tensorflow and arrayfire but have no idea how to reproduce this behaviour.

The only consistent observation I could draw is that it happens more often when I kill a process running on cuda and that this didn't happen with lua code.

edit: Also, this has been happening for months, spanning different driver, cuda, cudnn, pytorch releases and two operating systems.

body:
I encountered this over and over again on our servers, with `pytorch` most of the time but also `tensorflow` and `arrayfire` but have no idea how to reproduce this behaviour.

The only consistent observation I could draw is that it happens more often when I kill a process running on `cuda` and that this didn't happen with `lua` code.

edit: Also, this has been happening for months, spanning different driver, `cuda`, `cudnn`, `pytorch` releases and two operating systems.
